0 Param data.1 string m_text: Use Healing Incense to recover HP. HP recovers automatically outside of battle, so use this when locked in combat. You'll find Healing Incense in chests or on fallen enemies. You can use as many as you have. Level up to increase the number of Healing Incenses you can carry.

The mini map at the bottom right of the screen displays your current surroundings, showing areas you can reach and the location of your next objective. You can change the size of the mini map by pressing <ICON=BUTTON_MAP_CHANGE>.

The Living World
The land of flesh and blood. A natural world brimming with life, where creatures high and low rejoice in being alive.

The Beyond
The land of the dead. A world that exists in parallel with the Living World, occupying the same space, separated by a thin veil.

Press <ICON=BUTTON_WORLD_CAHANGE> to move between the Living World and the Beyond. The first time you travel to the Beyond in a new location, you will be Veil Blind, preventing you from sensing your surroundings. You are vulnerable as long as you are Veil Blind, so any attacks you suffer are fatal.

A nexus appears when you defeat a Sight Stealer, a rare type of Fallen that appears wreathed in a noxious miasma. If you Cross the Veil near a nexus, your Veil Blindness will be lifted in this region of the Beyond. This also bestows special effects known as Precepts on you and the Fallen within.
Use <ICON=BUTTON_KAMISHIRO_CAHANGE> to swap between the Daemons you can Manifest. Be sure to use the Daemon that best suits the situation.

Use <ICON=BUTTON_KAMISHIRO_CAHANGE_UP><ICON=BUTTON_KAMISHIRO_CAHANGE_LEFT><ICON=BUTTON_KAMISHIRO_CAHANGE_DOWN><ICON=BUTTON_KAMISHIRO_CAHANGE_RIGHT> to swap between the Daemons you can Manifest. Be sure to use the Daemon that best suits the situation.

Here are some of the debuffs that can affect your character:

<ICON=BUTTON_STATUS_POISON> Poison: Deals damage over time
<ICON=BUTTON_STATUS_CONFUSION> Muddle: Prevents Manifest & Incense
<ICON=BUTTON_STATUS_PARALYSIS> Paralyze: Slows movement
<ICON=BUTTON_STATUS_STUN> Stun: Inhibits all actions

Debuffs wear off over time. There are also resistances to each debuff that reduce the chance of being affected.

Affinity reflects the depth of possession with a Daemon. It rises during battle, and falls when you use skills. High Affinity increases your Attack, but if it goes over 150 it decreases Defense, so tread carefully!

When Affinity is 100 or higher, you can press <ICON=BUTTON_KIKOKU> to Manifest. When you Manifest, your stats increase even further, you can cancel all actions, and damage will not Stagger you.

While Manifested, Affinity becomes the Manifest Gauge. When the gauge reaches zero, Manifestation ends.
When you use a skill it has a chance to Awaken, triggering a variety of possible effects, chosen at random. These effects can turn the tide of battle, so be sure to make good use of them!
A skill has Awoken, granting you a new Awakening! Select Daemons, then Skill Tree to choose the skill that Awoke and enable the Awakening's power.

You've unlocked the Alchemist. Visit the Alchemist's shop just off the central plaza of Deto to enhance and customize your weapons. It's a good idea to pay a visit before embarking on a difficult mission.
Many Lost Souls wander Beyond the Veil. Good things may come to those who lend them a sympathetic ear.

Additional commands are available while at a Waystone:

Party
Manage your Daemons here.
Use <ICON=BUTTON_KAMISHIRO_CAHANGE> to Shift between Daemons during battle.

Daemon Lore
Commune with your Daemons, talking with them and reliving their memories.

Additional commands are available while at a Waystone:

Party
Manage your Daemons here.
Use <ICON=BUTTON_KAMISHIRO_CAHANGE_UP><ICON=BUTTON_KAMISHIRO_CAHANGE_LEFT><ICON=BUTTON_KAMISHIRO_CAHANGE_DOWN><ICON=BUTTON_KAMISHIRO_CAHANGE_RIGHT> to Shift between Daemons during battle.

Daemon Lore
Commune with your Daemons, talking with them and reliving their memories.

Fast Travel
Allows you to move between Waystones within the same map, or return to the world map.

Difficulty
You can adjust the game's difficulty here. Enemies will respawn at the newly selected difficulty.

Save
Save your progress.
Waystones mark the boundary between the Living World and the Beyond. Here you can commune with your Daemons and prepare them for battle.
You can use weapons you no longer need as raw materials to enhance other weapons. The weapon used for materials has no effect on the results of the enhancement, so choose any weapon you like.

Socketing shadestones in a weapon can imbue it with various effects. You cannot socket more than one of the same type of shadestone at the same time.

Once socketed, a shadestone cannot be removed, but socketing a new shadestone will replace the old one.

Your weapons and shadestones can be transmuted into new items using alchemy. Use weapons and shadestones you no longer need to meet the requirements for the desired transmutation. The list of possible transmutations changes every 100 enemies you kill.

Depending on the materials used to transmute, you may gain a bonus that affects the next list of transmutation candidates.

Increased Drops
Increases chance of weapons dropping. Unique for each weapon type.

Upgraded Weapon
Adds an upgraded weapon to the transmutation list.

Shadestone Socket +
Increases the number of shadestones that can be socketed in an item.

Refinement
Increases the chance of getting weapons and shadestones you don't have as possible transmutations.

Catalyst
Confers special effects when transmuting.
On rare occasions, you can recover the shadestones socketed in a weapon that you use as materials for transmutation. Recovered shadestones can be socketed in another weapon.
You can change a Daemon's weapon using Change Equipment on the Daemons menu.
You can assign up to four skills at once. New skills can be acquired using the Skill Tree. Go to the Skill Tree to acquire your first skill.
Each skill has a cooldown that begins when you use the skill. The skill cannot be used again until the cooldown ends. Choose a combination of skills that complement each other on the battlefield.

The skill tree is a visual depiction of a Daemon's soul. You can use soulstones on the skill tree to acquire new skills and abilities for each Daemon. After acquiring a skill, you can assign it for use in battle using Change Skills on the Daemons menu.

Your Daemon gained a rank! Each time a Daemon's rank increases, your bond with them deepens, and their capabilities while possessed increase. Your Daemon will continue to gain ranks as you acquire new skills.
The Awakenings you gain can be assigned to your skills. You might even acquire more Awakenings if you continue using the same skill.
Selecting Fast Travel allows you to go to the world map and move between any Waystones you've previously visited.
You can instantly travel to various destinations using the world map. Simply examine a Waystone, select Fast Travel, and move to the world map.
On rare occasions, Shadow may appear in the Living World. If you enter the Beyond while tainted by Shadow, you'll face special Fallen. Defeat them to claim rich rewards.

The Sanctum of Rebirth allows you to battle Fallen you've previously encountered. The Sanctum is divided into levels, each requiring a different number of Fallen to be defeated before you can advance to the next. Waystones only appear on certain levels.
Recovering a Daemon's memories allows them to share more of their past with you, strengthening your bond. Examine the Waystones you find and select Daemon Lore to view their memories.
<NAME=WP_0001_11_001> pre-order bonus acquired! Select Daemons, followed by Change Equipment to equip a new weapon. If you discard this weapon, you'll still be able to obtain it from other enemies.
<NAME=WP_0002_11_001> pre-order bonus acquired! Select Daemons, followed by Change Equipment to equip a new weapon. If you discard this weapon, you'll still be able to obtain it from other enemies.
<NAME=WP_0003_11_001> pre-order bonus acquired! Select Daemons, followed by Change Equipment to equip a new weapon. If you discard this weapon, you'll still be able to obtain it from other enemies.

Soulstone acquired! Soulstones form as a sign of the deepening possession of your Daemons. The more you use your Daemons, the more soulstones you can acquire.

Press <ICON=BUTTON_MAIN_MENU> to open the Main Menu, then select Daemons, followed by Skill Tree to use your soulstones.
When you get a new Daemon, you can customize it at a Waystone using the Party menu.

Defeated Fallen sometimes leave behind shadestones, the crystalized essence of their power. Some special shadestones begin with the name of the Fallen.

You can socket weapons with shadestones to harness their power. Visit the Alchemist to socket your weapons.

Some weapons are already socketed with shadestones when they drop.

<NAME=ma_0600_1>
You can now visit a new location, the <NAME=ma_0600_1>. Beyond the reach of the precepts, there you will face battles unlike those you've encountered so far.

Aeongate
A new portal has appeared in the Eternal Garden. The Aeongate enables you to travel freely between Kagachi's time and Soju's. The souls of the Lost remain trapped in their respective time until they are freed.

A passionate and caring Daemon. Aisha has been at Kagachi's side since he first became a Watcher. She still holds distant memories of fleeting happiness and an intense longing for love. 

Aisha can dash to move quickly across the battlefield, and the swords she wields strike fast and hard, making her a well-balanced warrior.

A Daemon with a strong sense of justice and unwavering honesty. Even in death, the inner turmoil Zaav felt in life is evident within him. He still holds distant memories of hatred suffered and deep regrets. 

Zaav wields spears as he charges into the fray, and he doesn't flinch at taking a few hard hits. He can also leap into the air, enabling him to attack from land or sky.

A cheerful Daemon who's easy to like, though dealings in his past life have left it difficult for him to trust others. Wil still holds distant memories of roaming far and wide, a time of great joy mixed with bitter hatred. 

Able to crush foes through stern defenses, he boasts the most offensive power of any Daemon, and he can use his massive axes to block incoming attacks.

Able to maintain her composure in most any situation, Izana knows how to stand her ground. She is an aloof Daemon who observes the living with great interest. Izana still holds distant memories of the cold tears of the dead and the twisted smiles of the living. 

She wields scythes that cut through large swathes of the battlefield. She also moves in the blink of an eye, enabling her to strike from the blind spots of her foes.

A Daemon who's a natural on the battlefield. Though Rigan's upbringing left him with a course tongue, his heart is no less kind for it. He still holds distant memories of turning away from a warm, outstretched hand.

Rigan uses speed as his weapon, defeating foes by overwhelming them with quick attacks. He also employs counterattacks and evasive rolls for a highly technical style of combat.

A Daemon whose manner and graceful bearing exude refinement. Dia always prioritizes her companions above herself. She still holds distant memories of wandering through darkness, and a faint light dancing in the palm of a hand. 

Wielding a crossbow in one hand and a pistol in the other, Dia unleashes a hail of attacks from afar. She can spring into the air, gaining distance, even while maintaining the onslaught.

An audacious Daemon who's never caught off guard, Gavod is keenly aware of the actions and emotions of others, and makes every effort to accommodate them. He still holds distant memories of loved ones, and eyes filled with despair.

Gavod uses shieldcannons, unwieldy weapons that afford the protection of a shield and allow the user to keep up heavy, close-range attacks before unleashing a devastating cannon blast.

A Daemon who devotes herself to fulfilling her destiny. Adrift on an endless sea of time, Lucika is determined to seek out what strength and wisdom she can. For only the light of hope can guide those who would usher in a new era.

While always in search of new devices to heighten her abilities, Lucika battles foes with deadly martial arts. She can deploy barriers to defend herself, and chain attacks to devastate foes.

A Daemon with an insatiable thirst for knowledge. Though Treize's curiosity extends to most topics, he has a blind spot when it comes to societal concerns. He still holds distant memories of strange eyes piercing him with their gaze.

Treize stands out from others with the ever-changing attacks of his chains. A master of debuffs, he can leap into the air, covering huge distances even as his chains lash out at enemies below.

A Daemon whose soul was forged in the great wilderness, Zephyr shuns the pack. He still holds distant memories of days spent locked in combat with worthy foes.

Zephyr does battle with those who possess him riding on his back. He moves constantly, excelling at hit-and-run tactics. Zephyr can double jump and use various charging skills to control the distance he keeps with his foes.

A machine who wanders myriad worlds. Jex has borne witness to countless beginnings, and endings. The experiences it accumulates become memory, and inform each successive action it takes.

Jex can use the skills of other Daemons. In total it can use eight different types of skills, shifting seamlessly between them in battle. It can spend Affinity to unleash special attacks.
